nominees.title: Belfast
nominees.description: A young boy and his working-class Belfast family experience the tumultuous late 1960s.

nominees.title: CODA
nominees.description: As a CODA (Child of Deaf Adults) Ruby is the only hearing person in her deaf family. When the family's fishing business is threatened, Ruby finds herself torn between pursuing her passion at Berklee College of Music and her fear of abandoning her parents.

nominees.title: Don't Look Up
nominees.description: Two low-level astronomers must go on a giant media tour to warn humankind of an approaching comet that will destroy planet Earth.

nominees.title: Drive My Car
nominees.description: A renowned stage actor and director learns to cope with his wife's unexpected passing when he receives an offer to direct a production of Uncle Vanya in Hiroshima.

nominees.title: Dune
nominees.description: A noble family becomes embroiled in a war for control over the galaxy's most valuable asset while its heir becomes troubled by visions of a dark future.

nominees.title: King Richard
nominees.description: A look at how tennis superstars Venus and Serena Williams became who they are after the coaching from their father Richard Williams.

nominees.title: Licorice Pizza
nominees.description: The story of Alana Kane and Gary Valentine growing up, running around and going through the treacherous navigation of first love in the San Fernando Valley, 1973.

nominees.title: Nightmare Alley
nominees.description: A grifter working his way up from low-ranking carnival worker to lauded psychic medium matches wits with a psychiatrist bent on exposing him.

nominees.title: The Power of the Dog
nominees.description: Charismatic rancher Phil Burbank inspires fear and awe in those around him. When his brother brings home a new wife and her son, Phil torments them until he finds himself exposed to the possibility of love.

nominees.title: West Side Story
nominees.description: An adaptation of the 1957 musical, West Side Story explores forbidden love and the rivalry between the Jets and the Sharks, two teenage street gangs of different ethnic backgrounds.

nominees.title: The Father
nominees.description: A man refuses all assistance from his daughter as he ages. As he tries to make sense of his changing circumstances, he begins to doubt his loved ones, his own mind and even the fabric of his reality.

nominees.title: Judas and the Black Messiah
nominees.description: Offered a plea deal by the FBI, William O'Neal infiltrates the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party to gather intelligence on Chairman Fred Hampton.

nominees.title: Mank
nominees.description: 1930s Hollywood is re-evaluated through the eyes of scathing social critic and alcoholic screenwriter Herman J. Mankiewicz as he races to finish the screenplay of Citizen Kane (1941).

nominees.title: Minari
nominees.description: A Korean family starts a farm in 1980s Arkansas.

nominees.title: Nomadland
nominees.description: A woman in her sixties, after losing everything in the Great Recession, embarks on a journey through the American West, living as a van-dwelling modern-day nomad.

nominees.title: Promising Young Woman
nominees.description: A young woman, traumatized by a tragic event in her past, seeks out vengeance against those who crossed her path.

nominees.title: Sound of Metal
nominees.description: A heavy-metal drummer's life is thrown into freefall when he begins to lose his hearing.

nominees.title: The Trial of the Chicago 7
nominees.description: The story of 7 people on trial stemming from various charges surrounding the uprising at the 1968 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.

nominees.title: Ford v Ferrari
nominees.description: American car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles battle corporate interference and the laws of physics to build a revolutionary race car for Ford in order to defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.

nominees.title: The Irishman
nominees.description: Hitman Frank Sheeran looks back at the secrets he kept as a loyal member of the Bufalino crime family.

nominees.title: Jojo Rabbit
nominees.description: A young German boy in the Hitler Youth whose hero and imaginary friend is the country's dictator is shocked to discover that his mother is hiding a Jewish girl in their home.

nominees.title: Joker
nominees.description: A mentally troubled stand-up comedian embarks on a downward spiral that leads to the creation of an iconic villain.

nominees.title: Little Women
nominees.description: Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.

nominees.title: Marriage Story
nominees.description: Noah Baumbach's incisive and compassionate look at a marriage breaking up and a family staying together.

April 6th, 1917. As an infantry battalion assembles to wage war deep in enemy territory, two soldiers are assigned to race against time and deliver a message that will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap.

nominees.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
nominees.description: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles.

nominees.title: Parasite
nominees.description: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.
